issue.title: [ENH] cutoff getter for Series, Panel, and Hierarchical mtypes

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This is an alternative approach to the `get_time_index` issue #2044.

Instead of a function that gets the entire time index - which is ambiguous for `Panel` data since different instances may have different index sets - this PR adds a function `get_cutoff` which returns the latest time index observed in the data.

The index is returned as a length 1 `pd.Index`, which can be indexed to get the value.
The function `get_cutoff` also allows to input an existing `cutoff` which shifts the `cutoff` in case a `np.ndarray` format is input.

This PR also adds replaces the logic of `_set_cutoff_from_y` in `BaseForecaster` with `get_cutoff`, which is hence upgraded to `Panel` and `Hierarchical` data container types.

FYI @danbartl, does this work for you?

Update: the original approach is failing tests since somewhere, length zero series `y` are generated as args to `fit` or `update`. I don't understand why this happens, and feel it should probably not. Raised a bug report https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2118. For now, it's treated as "no update to `cutoff` happens if length zero `y` is passed".

issue.title: [ENH] - Naive variance prediction estimator

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
> #### Reference Issues/PRs
#1687 

> #### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

@fkiraly 
As part of the probabilistic forecasting API, this will implement the `_predict_var` method to forecasters

> #### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

STEP [probabilistic forecasting API](https://github.com/sktime/enhancement-proposals/blob/main/steps/13_proba_forecasting/step.md)

> #### PR checklist

- [x] add `_predict_var` and its corresponding tag to the forecasting extension template.
- [x] add `NaiveVariance` composite class which implements the 'simple strategy' for variance prediction.
- [x] implement `_predict_var` and its corresponding in `NaiveVariance`.
- [x] implement `_predict_quantiles` in `NaiveVariance` where quantiles are inferred from a normal distribution. 
- [x] implement covariance prediction (`cov=True`)

> ##### For all contributions

- [x] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

body: @IlyasMoutawwakil, quick question: does this relate to your issue with `update_predict_predicted_cutoff`?

It also seems to be related to various failures of `test_update_predict_predicted_index`.

Attempted symptomatic fix in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2300, we need to treat the root cause eventually by reworking the `update` family of functions more cleanly.
FYI @GuzalBulatova - perhaps #2300 fixes your test failure?
